meanings.definition: The act of sending someone away or refusing to consider them.
meanings.sent1: After his rude behavior, the teacher gave him a dismissal from the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The dismissal of the unruly student was necessary to maintain order.
meanings.sent3: The dismissal of the noisy student made the class much quieter.
meanings.sent4: Her dismissal of the unwanted guest was swift and firm.
meanings.sent5: The dismissal of the troublemaker brought peace to the room.

meanings.definition: The act of removing someone from their job or position.
meanings.sent1: The company announced the dismissal of the manager due to misconduct.
meanings.sent2: The dismissal of the employee shocked the entire team.
meanings.sent3: The dismissal of the lazy worker was met with cheers from the hardworking staff.
meanings.sent4: His dismissal from the leadership role left a void in the team.
meanings.sent5: The dismissal of the coach led to a search for a new leader.

meanings.definition: The act of deciding that something is not important or worth considering.
meanings.sent1: Her dismissal of his excuses showed she was not convinced.
meanings.sent2: The dismissal of the minor details allowed them to focus on the main issue.
meanings.sent3: The dismissal of the irrelevant comments lightened the mood in the room.
meanings.sent4: His dismissal of her concerns left her feeling unheard.
meanings.sent5: The dismissal of the old traditions paved the way for new ideas.
